bibles.title: New Geneva Translation
bibles.description:
From a Bible translation you are right to expect a reproduction of the original text as accurately as possible. As important as the formal form of a statement may be in individual cases - it is crucial that their content is reproduced reliable, and understandable. Therefore, substantive accuracy for the New Geneva translation was our highest priority. In addition, this translation seeks to naturally communicate the scriptures in contemporary language, building confidence in the Bible and enable new readers to access God's Word.
Copyright © 2011 Genfer Bibelgesellschaft.

bibles.title: Schlacter 1951
bibles.description: The Schlachter-Bibel is a German translation of the Bible by Franz Eugen Schlachter, first translated from the Greek and Hebrew text of the Bible in 1905. Schlachter was a preacher of the Evangelische Gesellschaft in Bern, Switzerland influenced by the holiness movement.

bibles.title: Schlachter Version 2000
bibles.description:
The Schlachter-Bibel is a German translation of the Bible by Franz Eugen Schlachter, first translated from the Greek and Hebrew text of the Bible in 1905. The revised Schlachter Bible - 2000 version - was translated with the objective of reproducing the Word of God faithfully and understandably to the reader. This translation is in the Old Testament of the traditional Masoretic text and in the New Testament based on the traditional Greek text of the Reformation.
Copyright © 2000 Genfer Bibelgesellschaft.
